page.title: 20FOLKLORE AROUND WOLSTON
page.content: Knightlow Hill is the site of the { {Wroth Silver Ceremony} which is held annually to commemorate the payment of taxes to the Duke of Buccleuch, the local land owner of the time. Each of the villages in the{Knightlow Hundred} has to contribute a nominal sum on the 11th November each year. If payment is not forthcoming the {penalty}is to provide a white cow with pink ears and a red nose. This is obviously a very difficult task. The village representatives approach the stone before sunrise and walk around it before placing their money into the special{hollowed stone.}After each village has made its payment, breakfast is taken at The Dun Cow Hotel, originally financed by the Duke but latterly paid for by the participants. The ceremony has taken place for the last 800 years.
